result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrin Deshae Douglas

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyrin Deshae Douglas in court.  Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court for Tyrin Deshae Douglas.  Prosecuting attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Scheduling conference held. Case has been reassigned to Branch 37. Defense is requesting jury trial dates. Case is adjourned.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

JusticePoint Pretrial Services VIOLATION Report received and filed.  

Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report dated 9-7-2022; Received, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Tyrin Deshae Douglas in court with Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer N. Lorum. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with St. Benedicts or JTW.

Turnover to Justice Point for level 5 supervision. 
The Court ordered no use or possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.

Defendant Tyrin Deshae Douglas in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Tyrin Deshae Douglas in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report and do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Tyrin Deshae Douglas not in court, in custody.  Mark L Thomsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for return on doctor report. Defendant is in custody, not cooperating to appear. Defense requests an adjourned date.  Court orders case adjourned.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order of Commitment for Treatment, signed

Defendant Tyrin Deshae Douglas in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Tyrin Deshae Douglas in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant appears via Zoom. Hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: Dr. Pankiewicz. Arguments heard. Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame. The Court further authorized DHS to administer medications or treatment to the defendant. Case adjourned for return on doctor report, Branch 2.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyrin Deshae Douglas in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Case in court to reschedule contested competency hearing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Competency hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Tyrin Deshae Douglas not in court, in custody.  Allysa Bria Brown appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defendant not produced. Case heard off the record. Defense requests a contested hearing date. Courthouse is closed due to inclement weather. Case adjourned for scheduling, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE on next court date.

Defendant Tyrin Deshae Douglas in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Tyrin Deshae Douglas in custody.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tyrin Deshae Douglas appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 2.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Commissioner tolls the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  
This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c5e6133e-7164-4e97-66e6-4c87ef70fbdb  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Order for Competency Examination, signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
